intro: Physalis amica, commonly known as the common ground cherry, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its vibrant orange, lantern-shaped fruits that enclose the seeds. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow with five petals and bloom in the summer months. The fruit is often harvested when it turns a deep orange, indicating maturity.
